listing.title: Exceptional Front-End Developer
listing.description:
This is a remote position, but we prefer folks in America or Canada. This is a full time position, not hourly.

We're looking for a developer with master-level skills. Ideally you should know WordPress like the back of your hand. You’ll help develop technical projects, contribute to strategic planning and collaborate on high-level user experience designs. The ideal candidate is a code expert who is passionate about clean and scalable code and is not afraid to push technical innovation.

Responsibilities:

  • Masterful with CSS3, HTML5, Javascript, jQuery and PHP
  • Awesome WordPress theme development, plugin development and general customizations
  • Understanding design, UI, and UX concepts, and being able to translate these concepts to technical implementations.
  • Develop HTML for sites to function on multiple browsers, maintain CSS framework, identify and resolve all issues
  • Work with designers who prepare all production files in Sketch and then translate them into HTML templates
  • Work with the technology team to ensure thorough and effective documentation during the development process
  • Aid in the preparation of project time plans and adhere to them
  • Excellent trouble shooting, time management, attention to detail and communication skills (we use Slack!)
  • Extremely detail-oriented, and comfortable working in a fast paced environment

Nice to have:

  • Mapping experience with things like Mapbox
  • Data visualization with charting tools like amCharts and Tableau
  • Back end experience with SSH, SQL, devops, servers

Must-haves:

  • 4+ years professional experience
  • Proven track record of coding cutting-edge interactive projects
  • Must be a self-starter with an extraordinary work ethic
  • Flexibility, sense of humor, and a team mentality are assets

company.name: LGND
company.tagline: A digital storytelling company working with awesome clients.

listing.title: Web Developer (WordPress, PHP)
listing.description:
Yardi Systems, the leader in asset and property management software, is currently seeking a Web Developer to join their growing office in Santa Barbara, CA!

The full stack developer must be able to define project specifications, collaborate with stake holders, code complex business logic, implement intuitive user interfaces and otherwise support the corporate marketing websites. 


Responsibilities
· Create and maintain WordPress plugins and themes
· Develop appropriate code structures to solve specific tasks
· Coordinate/collaborate with staff and teams to develop and deploy projects
· Assist and support in the upkeep and maintenance of websites
· Troubleshoot and resolve technical problems


Requirements
· Associate degree, certification or commensurate experience
· 2+ years of full stack development experience
· Proficiency with PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript/JQuery
· Experience creating and using APIs and web services (REST/SOAP) 
· An assertive, engaging personality with a history of generating results
· Goal oriented and able to self-direct
· Team player who can motivate and encourage the best from others


Yardi Systems is a successful independent software company with a proven history of growth and market leadership in the multi-billion dollar global commercial real estate industry. We employ talented, motivated and innovative people that are focused on delivering superior solutions to our clients and are passionate about working with other highly skilled professionals in team environments.


If you are seeking an opportunity to join a winning team, work with the latest Microsoft technologies and develop your career, then Yardi Systems is the place for you. We have a pleasant and casual work environment, competitive salaries, and a comprehensive benefits package. Our corporate culture stresses integrity, respect, trust, responsibility, and fun.


EOE Race/Gender/Disability/Vets

listing.title: Junior Applications Developer
listing.description:
Great Opportunity for a Creative, Dependable, Self-Starting, Team Playing

Junior Applications Developer!

 

ABOUT US:

Cierant Corporation recently established a development center in the Charlottesville, VA area and is seeking a Junior Application Developer to become part of our expanding team in this new office. At Cierant Corporation we offer a flexible schedule to meet work/life balance. In addition to a generous benefits package, we believe in developing our employees! If this sounds like an opportunity you may be interested in, please read on...

Cierant Corporation is a marketing software and service company with specialized practices in three major industry areas: healthcare, consumer packaged goods and retail marketing, and publishing. We deliver bespoke enterprise application implementations to large enterprises. Check us out at www.cierant.com

As a certified woman-owned enterprise, we are committed to offering our employees an exceptional place to work, learn and advance their careers while maintaining an effective work-life balance. Our team is filled with hikers, musicians, actors, gardeners, cooks, cyclists, moms, dads, sons, daughters...in short...real people. We offer competitive salaries, extensive benefits (medical, dental, 401(k), etc...) and a real commitment to letting our people develop real skills here at work, and outside the office.

Our move into Charlottesville, VA is based on a belief that the area is magnet for the type of people we think will make great additions to our team ---people with a passion for education, technology and entrepreneurial success, seamlessly interwoven for a love of community, the outdoors, the arts, and the world beyond work.

 

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

Our ideal candidate will be a creative, dependable, self-starter who takes initiative, can meet deadlines and communicate well while functioning in a small team environment in the development, implementation, integration and maintenance of applications in our marketing portals and automation team. We are looking for developers who can work in C# .NET deployed in an AWS host environment, including integration with industry leading platforms for business intelligence, document customization and eDelivery. The team will work on development of bespoke enterprise systems to support marketing automation, collaboration and budget management. Positive, can-do attitudes go a long way in our company…..

 

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:

·         Coding, testing and documentation for enterprise application implementations

·         Working with local team and our Danbury, CT headquarters team to troubleshoot issues

·         Creating documents such as release plans for production releases

·         Deploying and debug applications in the development environment

·         Troubleshooting environmental issues in QA

·         Completing technical development tasks pertaining to applications per approved projects and allocated budgets

·         Multi-tiered custom application design & development

 

QUALIFICATIONS WERE LOOKING FOR:

·         2-4 years of experience in (Application development, Infrastructure Engineer, Software Engineer).

·         2-4 years of experience with developing .NET Web applications.

·         Experience working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial project environment

·         Microsoft Skills: C#, ASP.NET, SQL Server, Visual Studio

·         Experience in deployment of cloud-based applications, preferably in AWS environment

·         Experience with web service standards (WCF, REST, and SOAP)

·         Knowledge or experience with programming around Xmpie

 

SOME PREFERRED SKILLS:

·         BS/BA in Computer Science or a related discipline

·         Microsoft Skills: MVC, Razor, PowerApps, Flow, InfoPath

·         Web skills: HTML, JavaScript, CSS, AJAX, JQuery, Angular JS, Bootstrap, XML

·         Security skills: SAML, Oauth,

·         Understanding of basic agile development methodologies

·         Comprehension of n-Tier architectures

·         Understands SOAs and service layer interactions

·         Should be knowledgeable of Source Code Control tools, preferably Git

·         Understanding of SQL database principals including database triggers, SQL syntax and stored procedures.

·         Excellent communication both written and verbal

·         Strong Web Development Experience preferred

 

HERE'S WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU: 

Culture and Environment –  we are looking for the best of the best to support our clients!  We want creative, innovative thinkers that get energized from challenge and take it head on!  We welcome positive, enthusiastic folks that are upbeat and team spirited.

Work/life balance -  If you need to work from home, we are flexible –as long as the work gets done and deadlines are met!  Although, not entirely remote, we offer extremely flexible work schedules.

401k Retirement Plan & Profit Sharing Plan – we have a  very generous company match.

Flex Spending Account (aka FLEX Section 125 – Cafeteria Plan) –helps you put aside pre-tax dollars, reducing your taxable income…so, it saves you money in the long run.

Education Reimbursement, skills training, seminars and webinars – we want the best employees so, we encourage you to seek educational opportunities!

High Speed Internet Subsidy Program – we’ll offset your cost.

Vacation -  paid time to relax and enjoy life!

Holiday/Floating Holiday Pay – 6 paid company observed holidays and an additional 6 floating holidays of your choice, we’ve got you covered.

Life Insurance & Accidental Death & Dismemberment – Cierant pays 100% of the premium for our employees.

Short Term Disability Insurance  - We pay 100% of the premium for our amazing employees.

Long Term Disability Insurance - Cierant pays 100% of the premium for our employees. 

Major Medical and Dental plans – we subsidize some of the premium cost to make it more affordable for our employees.

Employee Discounts – we’ve partnered with various vendors to offer our employees discounts on movie tickets, movie rentals, Broadway shows, theme parks, sporting events, online shopping, gift certificates, seasonal ski tickets and much more!  Happy employees make satisfied clients!

 

PLEASE READ: Cierant will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. We "DO NOT" provide sponsorship or relocation.

 

NO AGENCIES PLEASE!

Cierant is a Woman Owned Business and an Equal Opportunity Employer
listing.perks:
HERE'S WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN OUR TEAM:

·         We are a fun group.
·         We love what we do.
·         We work in a business casual environment.
·         We value your ideas.  We will value you!
·         We offer great  benefits and flexible schedules!
listing.howto_apply:
INTERESTED?
Tell us why you want to join Cierant and what your "salary requirements" are.  You can apply right on this site or resumes can be sent to:   recruiting@cierant.com    If you are a smart, super talented Developer who is looking for a challenge we'd love to hear from you.

listing.title: Back-End Developer
listing.description:
Our developers create industry-leading digital work for some of the most recognized brands on the planet. A successful candidate will bring a track record of constantly innovating and maintaining a broad knowledge of development principles, industry trends, and emerging technologies. Expert-level knowledge of one or more system languages, database architecture, and Unix operating systems is required -- experience working in an agency or project-driven environment is a plus.

Primary responsibilities:

  • Develop back-end solutions for data-driven executions in web, mobile, and emerging technology. Projects including but not limited to API development, custom content management, front-end integration, image/video rendering, and other complex builds.
  • Lead the way on project architecture and database structure while utilizing best practices in performance, stability, scalability and security.
  • Contribute to concept development with multi-disciplinary teams of developers, creatives, and producers.
  • Maintain proficiency in the widest possible range of back-end web development areas including Python, Java, shell scripting, database architecture, and Unix operating systems. Our front-end developers will lean on you to design API services, set up deployment servers, and more.
  • A fundamental ability to use HTML, CSS, and JavaScript in various scenarios.
  • Bonus points for knowledge of Redis, Gulp, Google Cloud Services (AppEngine, Compute Engine, Datastore, etc.), Android/iOS development, virtualization (e.g., Docker).

This is a full-time position at our office in downtown Norfolk, VA. Grow offers paid relocation and temporary housing for selected candidates.

Benefits

Amazing clients and an inspiring environment come standard, but the best part is finding yourself among a close-knit group of 40+ incredibly talented and motivated colleagues. We’re part of a community of like-minded people in the Norfolk / Virginia Beach area who spend our time creating great work and building a culture around us—with lovely beaches, urban amenities, and family-friendly opportunities throughout the region.

 

You’ll start with a full month of paid vacation and holiday leave, including two weeks in which the company pauses operations—one at midsummer, and one at the holidays. A wealth of additional company benefits include health, dental, matching 401k, disability, paid training, and more.

listing.title: Open Source Interactive Developer
listing.description:
GS&F is searching for an experienced Open Source Interactive Developer to support our burgeoning interactive development work. For this role, we are looking for individuals with the right mix of Open Source experience, an entrepreneurial mindset, strong interpersonal skills, and comfort in front of new client relationships. A mixture of coder, strategist, business leader and technologist, you should thrive in a fast-paced environment and be comfortable partnering with cross-functional groups. This position is a unique one in the agency, and prior agency experience is strongly preferred for this role.

 

Preferred Qualifications and Experience:

• 3–5 years of experience building and delivering websites based on CMS platforms, including WordPress, SquareSpace, WebFlow or other

•  Highly proficient in HTML, CSS and JavaScript

• Ability to use web browser development tools to inspect and understand webpage source code on multiple devices

• Familiarity with common web development tools, including a text/code editor, FTP/SFTP, webpack, Git, Jira and similar

• Familiarity with UI/UX design tools, including Photoshop, Sketch and InVision

• Project portfolio showing contributions to both “front end” and “back end” initiatives

• Work with stakeholders to determine client requirements for fast-turnaround websites

• Collaborate to develop design concepts and technical approaches to meet objectives within client budget and timeline

• Create HTML, CSS and JavaScript assets using CMS and other web development tools per design and technical requirements

• Work with other members of Digital Solutions team to achieve integration, quality, deployment and hosting

 

If you feel you meet the above qualifications and experience, go to gsandf.com/careers to apply.
listing.perks: Above competitive benefit offerings, creative and dev-friendly work environment, entrepreneurial approach to the work, work from home options available and more

company.name: GS&F
company.tagline: Fully-integrated ad agency with the largest Dev & UX team in Nashville

listing.title: Lead Product Designer
listing.description:
Are you interested in working with businesses to help design software that will truly have an impact on their bottom line? Do you want to work with a remote-first team that also values face-to-face interaction? Do you want to work with customers that are eager for strategic direction and guidance?
 
As Simple Thread’s Lead Product Designer, you’ll be responsible for transforming the company from an engineering oriented consultancy, into a consultancy that focuses on melding design and engineering at every level. You’ll need to evangelize the mindset of a designer with the rest of the team, as well as work with our clients to create great products.
 
Do you love to…
  • Collaborate with customers to understand their goals and challenges.
  • Take concepts and ideas, and turn them into delightful and usable products.
  • Focus on the user, and use user centered design to drive-out and address customers’ needs.
  • Design simple, beautiful, and usable user experiences.
  • Use both lightweight mockups and high fidelity prototypes to help validate design decisions.
  • Communicate with non-designers to articulate the value of good design.
  • Stay abreast of emerging UX and UI trends.
Do you have?
  • 5+ years of UX and/or UI design experience working with digital products.
  • Experience with UI design and prototyping tools such as Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, InVision, etc…
  • Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript… not a developer, but enough experience to know how to communicate with developers and to know what is possible.
  • A solid understanding of UX design principles.
  • An awesome portfolio.
If would be awesome if you…
  • Were within easy driving distance of Richmond or Charlottesville Virginia!
  • Didn’t mind meeting clients face to face on occasion, which could mean traveling up to 20% of the time.
About Simple Thread
 
Simple Thread is a growing central-Virginia based consulting company founded by two friends in 2010. We value quality, balance, and focus in our work and our lives over everything else. We strive to focus on our customers and keep a work/life balance that many consulting companies don’t have. We are growing quickly and looking to grow our team with individuals who share our values.

listing.title: Full Stack Developer
listing.description:
The Karcher Group is currently hiring an experienced Full Stack Developer to join our North Canton, Ohio office.

4-6 years working experience covering:
  • Creation of platformed websites and PWAs (WordPress / HubSpot / Static)
  • Development and debugging of custom solutions (JavaScript / PHP)
  • Integration and debugging JavaScript frameworks (Angular / React)
  • Integration and debugging back-end data to markup (API / MySQL)
  • Basic web server management (Apache, IIS)
  • Development, debugging, and documenting (HTML / SCSS / JavaScript)
  • Asset management and optimization (JavaScript / Images / Fonts / Video / Audio)
  • Accessibility (implementing WCAG2 A and AA)
  • Search optimization (implementing Schema)
  • Performance (running and evaluating automated reports)
  • UI patterns and framework use (Bootstrap / Foundation)
Comfortable working with:
  • Project management tools (Slack / Teamwork)
  • Code editors (Sublime / Visual Studio)
  • Image editors (Sketch / Photoshop / Illustrator)
  • Source publishing (Git / FTP)
  • Code preprocessing and minification (Gulp / Webpack / ImageOptim)
  • QA (Linting / Unit testing / Google PageSpeed / Browserstack)
  • Back-end programming in an MVC architecture (PHP / VB.NET)
  • Databases (SQL / MySQL)
Necessary soft-skills:
  • Collaborate with a team
  • Communicate complex topics effectively with clients
  • Read and write documentation of requirements
  • Keep current with industry standards, trends, and limitations
  • Active participant in sharing, developing, and following industry best practices
Daily life of a Full-Stack Developer:
  • Collaborate on solutions that meet project goals
  • Self-manage workload for multiple, concurrent projects
  • Report needs, progress, and/or problems
  • Code from requirements documentation in a focused, agile workflow
  • Develop websites and supplemental promotional materials (emails, landing pages) based on designed layouts and/or design systems
  • Handle production design for established projects

Oh, and if VB.NET is your jam, we’d still like to talk!

Sound like the right fit? Apply online today!
listing.perks: Full benefits including health, dental, vision, 401K, paid time off, holidays, some remote opportunity, incentive and referral bonus program, fun casual environment, pool table, snacks, deck, grill, great coffee!
listing.howto_apply: Please include resume, and link to online portfolio or examples of work.

listing.title: Drupal Developer
listing.description:
The Congressional Budget Office is a small nonpartisan agency that provides economic and budgetary analysis to the Congress. The Office of Communications seeks a second front-end web developer to serve as a systems administrator for CBO’s public website and as a driver of innovative digital solutions.
 

The Office of Communications supports CBO’s mission by developing, executing, and managing successful digital strategies. The web developer will provide technical expertise to help ensure seamless day-to-day operations and develop tactical and strategic improvements to CBO’s digital presence. This is a midlevel position requiring an experienced person who can shift seamlessly between producing well-documented code, upgrading Drupal, writing valid CSS3, designing user interfaces, and effectively integrating interactive media projects into CBO’s website. The role’s responsibilities include:

  • Creating prototypes and demonstrations of new functionality, in line with CBO’s mobile-first approach, that makes the agency’s work more accessible and interactive while providing optimal user experience.
  • Serving as a technical expert for digital projects, ensuring that new capabilities are compatible with CBO’s content management system (Drupal) and can be effectively integrated into the website.
  • Modifying existing code bases, adding or configuring new Drupal modules, and creating custom modules or applications as needed to implement digital enhancements. Monitoring and applying necessary patches to ensure consistency between module dependencies.
  • Extending themes, user interfaces, information taxonomy, and architecture to meet stakeholders’ objectives.
  • Monitoring CBO’s cloud-hosted servers and conducting regular reviews to ensure that CBO is receiving the maximum benefit from its external infrastructure.
  • Helping to manage relationships with external contractors, serving as a day-to-day point of contact.
Qualifications

Applicants must have a bachelor’s degree and at least five years of experience maintaining websites; that experience must include working with Drupal. An additional four years of related experience may be used in lieu of a bachelor’s degree for a total of nine years of experience. In addition, applicants must:

  • Be experienced at working with open-source web platforms.
  • Have experience managing deployments in Drupal with multiple developers across different environments as well as experience developing custom Drupal modules.
  • Have strong JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3 development skills, as well as experience using a CSS preprocessor, such as SASS. Be skilled working with MySQL databases and PC data formats including CSV, JSON, and XML.
  • Have experience using Drupal development tools such as Lando, Drush, and Composer.
  • Have experience with mobile-first or adaptive design principles.
  • Demonstrate expert PHP development skills.
  • Have a firm grasp of Drupal 8 APIs.
  • Possess a working knowledge of community-contributed Drupal modules.
  • Be self-motivated, detail-oriented, and capable of managing complex projects.
  • Have a working knowledge of information taxonomy and data management.
  • Be experienced with maintaining a central repository (for example, Git) for managing and documenting a code base.

Desirable skills include: Experience working with managed cloud hosting; experience with client-side presentation libraries, such as D3, TauCharts, or Chartist; configuration management experience with Drupal 8 and familiarity with headless/decoupled Drupal as well as React or Angular (Javascript libraries); experience using and customizing Apache Lucene/Solr, including fielded searches and customized indexing; experience developing user interfaces for websites that publish large quantities of text, graphs, and other data visualizations; mature data visualization and presentation skills; a working understanding of statistics and economics; experience integrating external web services (REST, JSON, XML-RPC); and experience with project management and collaboration tools such as JIRA
listing.perks: Federal Benefits, Annual Leave, Sick Leave, Paid Holidays, Pension Plan

listing.title: Front-End Designer/Developer
listing.description:
Chromatic in a Nutshell

Chromatic is a digital agency focused on web design, development, process, and training. We have over 10 years experience helping some of the web's biggest brands solve problems on the web using Drupal and other open source technologies. Our team is completely distributed, and while we may be spread across the globe, our culture keeps us close together.

Role Summary

Chromatic is searching for an outgoing and motivated front-end designer/developer with exceptional communication skills who would be excited to work with a talented and tight-knit team in our compelling saga to rid the world of bad websites. A strong online portfolio of your work should be presented.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Work closely with clients and Chromatic team members on engagements to deliver exceptional designs, code, consulting, and advice.
  • Participate in and contribute to peer design/code reviews and project stand-ups.
  • Evangelize design/development/process best practices to Chromatic’s clients and the community.
  • Engage with the open source community via code contributions, projects, presentations, blog posts, etc.
  • Estimating effort required to implement technical functionality.
  • Attending client on-sites.
  • The ability to present yourself to others in a way that represents Chromatic well.
  • Enthusiasm, personality, teamwork and a positive attitude count tremendously. Serious candidates will be sure to include an introductory video with their application.

What We Are Looking For

Experience with the following is required:

  • Proficient in designing and delivering assets via HTML/CSS.
  • Strong proficiency in core front-end development technologies (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript/ES6).
  • CSS preprocessors.
  • Task runners.
  • HTML5 APIs.
  • Web content management systems.
  • REST web services.
  • Developing responsive web and/or mobile applications.
  • Creation of and adherence to best practices.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
  • Strategic thinker that often anticipates problems before they occur.

Experience with the following is a plus:

  • Object-oriented patterns.
  • Strong Drupal theming.
  • Wordpress theming.
  • Agile project management methodologies.
  • Git and GitHub pull request/code review workflows.
  • Designing, developing and maintaining front-end component libraries or style guides.

Some Other Important Traits

  • Chromatic is a distributed team, so strong communication skills, both verbal and written, are of the utmost importance.
  • The ability to brainstorm ideas, do research, remain current with industry trends and best practices.
  • Enthusiasm, personality, teamwork and a positive attitude count tremendously. Serious candidates will be sure to include an introductory video with their application.

What sets Chromatic apart from a typical job?

  • Work from wherever you want, whenever you want - Our office is completely distributed, you may work from wherever is most effective for you. We encourage our team members to work when it is convenient for them, when they’ll do their best work.
  • Reasonable Bookings - We book our team members with a max of 30-35 hours per week for project work. We believe more than that is asking too much. The other 5-10 hours is reserved for team meetings, community contribution, and professional/skill development.
  • Vacation - Chromatic does not set rigid vacation limits. We encourage our people to take vacation when they want/need it. So long as it doesn’t interfere with existing contracts or compromise project deadlines, we’re all for it.
  • Health Insurance - Chromatic provides competitive medical/dental/vision insurance.
  • 401(k) - Chromatic provides employees a 401k plan along with a 3% employer contribution.
  • Disability Insurance - Chromatic provides both short and long term disability insurance.
  • Life Insurance - All employees are provided with a term life insurance policy.
  • Hardware - Chromatic is primarily an Apple-based company, but we allow our team members to choose their own hardware and we ensure everyone has up-to-date equipment and software.
  • Exciting Projects - Chromatic consistently participates in projects with exciting, high-profile brands and some of the most highly trafficked sites on the web; some of which include Martha Stewart, NBC / MSNBC, Shape, Parents, Casper, State Farm, Emeril Brands, Adobe.
  • Conferences - Chromatic frequently sends team members to attend and speak at industry conferences, including DrupalCon.
  • Company Retreat - Once a year, we gather the entire company to spend quality time together away from our desks.
  • Spotify Subscription - Music is important to us; we provide for a Spotify subscription (or equivalent) for all of our employees.
  • Drupalize.me Membership - Want to spend your extra hours improving your Drupal skills? We have a Drupalize.me membership at the ready.
  • Workflow - We firmly believe in a strong, consistent deployment workflow. We insist on proper code reviews on all of our projects. This not only ensures our code quality but more so, makes us better developers.
  • Team & Culture - We work and support each other as a team. We make an effort to get together numerous times per year and support each other personally and professionally at every opportunity.

company.name: Chromatic
company.tagline: Ridding the world of bad websites

listing.title: Web Applications Developer
listing.description:
POSITION SUMMARY:   
We are seeking a Web Applications Developer to play key role in facilitating an effective online customer journey for guests seeking to purchase tickets, tours, memberships, field trips, and more for a world-class aquarium, planetarium, and natural history museum in Golden Gate Park. As we prepare to transition to a new Point of Sale, CRM systems and eCommerce platform, the Web Applications Developer will be instrumental in helping to successfully implement the newly redesigned eCommerce experience. The Web Applications Developer will report to the Business Systems Manager in the Information Technology Division, and will collaborate with a cross-functional team of developers, designers and business stakeholders to design, develop, implement and sustain custom solutions that leverage ticketing and CRM to meet business needs for internal and external partners. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to the Academy’s mission to explore, explain and sustain the natural world by enabling online transactions that will allow guests to discover world-class exhibits and experiences.

The California Academy of Sciences welcomes people of all backgrounds, identities, and beliefs to join us in achieving our mission to explore, explain, and sustain life on Earth. We place diversity, equity, and inclusion at the heart of our recruiting efforts and strive to build a culture centered on mutual respect, equal treatment, and the opportunity to succeed.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND FUNCTIONS:

  • Support the development, integration and the upkeep of the Academy’s eCommerce solutions to create an effective ticket purchase experience, leveraging API of the Academy’s ticketing and CRM system (i.e. Tessitura). 
  • Develop, sustain and support integrations leveraging APIs for other e-commerce related functions including CRM integration with our email marketing platform (i.e. Maropost).
  • Backend development using object-oriented back-end programming languages such as PHP, C# and Java. PHP will be the primary language needed for server-side Drupal customizations. C# or Java would be the preferred language used to develop API integrations. 
  • Cooperative and cross-functional development with an external agency and the Academy's Marketing Web Team
  • Front-end development and server-side customization using Drupal or other cross-platform CMS.
  • Use of advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as .NET, Spring, NodeJS & AngularJS to develop effective and comprehensive solutions.
  • Working and deploying within GIT managed projects
  • Leverage ticketing and CRM APIs to develop internal and external custom solutions to meet business needs
  • Collaboration with creative team, and custom web development from wireframes, designs, redlines, or style guides ·        
  • Support Business Applications team in day to day support of ticketing operations.  
  • Create visual enhancements that align with an existing web UX/UI.
  • Demonstrate understanding of how to apply OWASP security principles
  • Generate relevant technical documentation
  • Follow all Academy safety regulations
  • Other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS: 
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required or preferred.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:
A qualified candidate will have a combination of the following experience and/or equivalent education:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or relative work experience
  • A minimum of 2 years web and/or application development and experience of integrating web assets with services.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

  • Web Development Skills: Comprehensive knowledge of Web Services (REST is required/SOAP is useful) JavaScript, JQuery, HTML, HTML5, CSS, CSS3, SASS, Web User Interface Design (UI). Advanced understanding of rest web services and integration techniques for;
    o   Google Analytics and Tag Manager
    o   Payment Express or other payment processing engines
    o   Microsoft Technologies
    o   Maropost or other email marketing platforms
  • Application Development Skills: Comprehensive knowledge of one or more Object Oriented Programming language (OOP) and the ability to apply OOP to develop applications for internal and public consumption via REST APIs.
  • Collaboration Skills: Ability to work as part of a team or collaborate well with colleagues toward mutual goals.
  • Interpersonal Skills: Ability to work efficiently and communicate with staff, cross-functional teams and external customers from different backgrounds, identities and experiences.
  • Innovation Skills: Ability to bring new ideas, create inventive solutions and find efficiencies to transform manually or detailed processes. 

LANGUAGE SKILLS: 
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.  Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.  Ability to speak effectively before groups or individuals.  Bilingual (spoken and/or written) in Spanish, Cantonese, Mandarin, or other non-English language preferred.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS & WORK ENVIRONMENT: 
The physical demands and work environment described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable persons with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, sit, walk, reach with hands and arms, and talk or hear. Must be able to lift 20lbs.  Must be able to perform repetitive motions 80% of the time.

The California Academy of Sciences will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance (SF Police Code, Article 49).

The California Academy of Sciences is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to ensure that all employees and applicants receive equal consideration and treatment, regardless of race, color, creed, gender (including gender identity or gender expression), religion, marital or domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical, mental or medical disability, sex, sexual orientation, citizenship, military service status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state or federal law or local ordinance.

The California Academy of Sciences is a non-smoking facility. There is also no smoking in Golden Gate Park.
listing.howto_apply:
APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS:  
Please submit your cover letter and resume online at https://calacademy.snaphire.com Note that the recruitment timeline for positions vary and depend on many factors, so it is impossible to accurately predict when a position will close. We appreciate your patience during this process. No phone calls please.
